ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Problems with user-agent
ygData.msgSnippet: I have run the same crawl using the WUI and it worked without error.  It seems to be a problem with the nowui mode not using the order.xml file that I

I have run the same crawl using the WUI and it worked without error.  It 
seems to be a problem with the nowui mode not using the order.xml file 
that I specified.  To test this I added some junk code to the order.xml 
file that would cause it not to validate (changed a tag name).  The WUI 
caught the error.  The nowui mode did not.  Im guessing the nowui mode 
is using an order.xml file other than the one I specified.

Rich Collins
Director of Information Technology
InjuryBoard.com
813-225-1313 x228
rcollins@...



Kristinn Sigurdsson wrote:

> I belive that the WUI prints a red star next to the setting if it is 
> invalid. Maybe it should be more forceful, but at the time the 
> functionality was added, it was believed to be sufficient.
>  
> - Kris
>
>     -----Original Message-----
>     *From:* Lars Clausen [mailto:lc@...]
>     *Sent:* 2. febrï¿½ar 2005 11:04
>     *To:* Heritrix mailing list
>     *Subject:* Re: [archive-crawler] Problems with user-agent
>
>     On Tue, 2005-02-01 at 21:45, Rich Collins wrote:
>     > Executing the following command:
>     > /home/apps/heritrix/bin/heritrix -n
>     > /home/apps/heritrix/conf/profiles/testProfile/order.xml
>     >
>     > With the following order.xml config:
>     >
>     > <map name="http-headers">
>     >     <string name="user-agent">Mozilla/5.0 (compatible;
>     heritrix/1.2.0
>     > +http://firms.injuryboard.com/)
>     <http://firms.injuryboard.com/%29></string>
>     >     <string name="from">crawler@...</string>
>     > </map>
>     >
>     > I get the following error:
>     >
>     > Tue Feb  1 15:46:41 EST 2005 Starting heritrix
>     >
>     org.archive.crawler.framework.exceptions.InitializationException: You
>     > must set the User-Agent and From HTTP header values to
>     acceptable strings.
>     >  User-Agent: [software-name](+[info-url])[misc]
>     >  From: [email-address]
>     >
>     > Is that the correct place in the order file to place the
>     user-agent headers?
>
>     Would it be difficult to have the WUI check that you enter a valid
>     user
>     agent and from string?  Or is the check too complex to put in a place
>     like that?  Of course Heritrix would still want to check, but it's a
>     silly thing to have a crawl fail on.
>
>     -Lars
>
